verses.verse: (For the choir director; according to Shoshannim.<WH7799> [A Psalm] of David.) Save<WH3467> me, O God,<WH430> For the waters<WH4325> have threatened<WH935> <WH5704> my life.<WH5315>
I have sunk<WH2883> in deep<WH4688> mire,<WH3121> and there<WH369> is no<WH369> foothold;<WH4613> I have come<WH935> into deep<WH4615> waters,<WH4325> and a flood<WH9578> overflows<WH7857> me.
I am weary<WH3021> with my crying;<WH7121> my throat<WH1627> is parched;<WH2787> My eyes<WH5869> fail<WH3615> while I wait<WH3176> for my God.<WH430>

Those who hate<WH8130> me without<WH2600> a cause<WH2600> are more<WH7231> than<WH4480> the hairs<WH8185> of my head;<WH7218> Those who would destroy<WH6789> me are powerful,<WH6105> being wrongfully<WH8267> my enemies,<WH340> What<WH834> I did not steal,<WH1497> I then<WH227> have to restore.<WH7725>
O God,<WH430> it is Thou who dost know<WH3045> my folly,<WH200> And my wrongs<WH819> are not hidden<WH3582> from Thee.

May those who wait<WH6960> for Thee not be ashamed<WH954> through me, O Lord<WH136> God<WH3068> of hosts;<WH6635> May those who seek<WH1245> Thee not be dishonored<WH3637> through me, O God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478>
Because<WH3588> for Thy sake<WH5921> I have borne<WH5375> reproach;<WH2781> Dishonor<WH3639> has covered<WH3680> my face.<WH6440>
I have<WH1961> become<WH1961> estranged<WH2114> from my brothers,<WH251> And an alien<WH5237> to my mother's sons.<WH1121>
For zeal<WH7068> for Thy house<WH1004> has consumed<WH398> me, And the reproaches<WH2781> of those who reproach<WH2778> Thee have fallen<WH5307> on me.
When I wept<WH1058> in my soul<WH5315> with fasting,<WH6685> It became<WH1961> my reproach.<WH2781>
When I made<WH5414> sackcloth<WH8242> my clothing,<WH3830> I became<WH1961> a byword<WH4912> to them.
Those who sit<WH3427> in the gate<WH8179> talk<WH7878> about me, And I [am] the song<WH5058> of the drunkards.<WH7941> <WH8354>

But as for me, my prayer<WH8605> is to Thee, O Lord,<WH3068> at an acceptable<WH7522> time;<WH6256> O God,<WH430> in the greatness<WH7230> of Thy lovingkindness,<WH2617> Answer<WH6030> me with Thy saving<WH3468> truth.<WH571>
Deliver<WH5337> me from the mire,<WH2916> and do not let me sink;<WH2883> May I be delivered<WH5337> from my foes,<WH8130> and from the deep<WH4615> waters.<WH4325>
May the flood<WH9578> of water<WH4325> not overflow<WH7857> me, And may the deep<WH4688> not swallow<WH1104> me up, And may the pit<WH875> not shut<WH332> its mouth<WH6310> on me.
Answer<WH6030> me, O Lord,<WH3068> for Thy lovingkindness<WH2617> is good;<WH2896> According to the greatness<WH7230> of Thy compassion,<WH7356> turn<WH6437> to me,
And do not hide<WH5641> Thy face<WH6440> from Thy servant,<WH5650> For I am in distress;<WH9503> answer<WH6030> me quickly.<WH4118>
Oh draw<WH7126> near<WH7126> to my soul<WH5315> [and] redeem<WH1350> it; Ransom<WH6299> me because<WH4616> of my enemies!<WH340>
Thou dost know<WH3045> my reproach<WH2781> and my shame<WH1322> and my dishonor;<WH3639> All<WH3605> my adversaries<WH6887> are before<WH5048> Thee.

Reproach<WH2781> has broken<WH7665> my heart,<WH3820> and I am so sick.<WH5136> And I looked<WH6960> for sympathy,<WH5110> but there<WH369> was none,<WH369> And for comforters,<WH5162> but I found<WH4672> none.<WH3808>
They also gave<WH5414> me gall<WH7219> for my food,<WH1267> And for my thirst<WH6772> they gave<WH8248> me vinegar<WH2558> to drink.<WH8248>
May their table<WH7979> before<WH6440> them become<WH1961> a snare;<WH4170> And when they are in peace,<WH7965> [may it become] a trap.<WH4170>
May their eyes<WH5869> grow<WH2821> dim<WH2821> so<WH4480> that they cannot<WH4480> see,<WH7200> And make their loins<WH4975> shake<WH4571> continually.<WH8548>
Pour<WH8210> out Thine indignation<WH2195> on them, And may Thy burning<WH2740> anger<WH639> overtake<WH5381> them.
May their camp<WH2918> be desolate;<WH8074> May none<WH408> dwell<WH3427> in their tents.<WH168>
For they have persecuted<WH7291> him whom<WH834> Thou Thyself<WH859> hast smitten,<WH5221> And they tell<WH5608> of the pain<WH4341> of those whom Thou hast wounded.<WH2491>
Do Thou add<WH5414> iniquity<WH5771> to their iniquity,<WH5771> And may they not come<WH935> into Thy righteousness.<WH6666>
May they be blotted<WH4229> out of the book<WH5612> of life,<WH2416> And may they not be recorded<WH3789> with the righteous.<WH6662>
But I am afflicted<WH6041> and in pain;<WH3510> May Thy salvation,<WH3444> O God,<WH430> set<WH7682> me [securely] on high.<WH7682>
I will praise<WH1984> the name<WH8034> of God<WH430> with song,<WH7892> And shall magnify<WH1431> Him with thanksgiving.<WH8426>
And it will please<WH3190> the Lord<WH3068> better<WH3190> than<WH4480> an ox<WH7794> [Or] a young<WH6499> bull<WH6499> with horns<WH7161> and hoofs.<WH6536>
The humble<WH6035> have seen<WH7200> [it and] are glad;<WH8055> You who seek<WH1875> God,<WH430> let your heart<WH3824> revive.<WH2421>
For the Lord<WH3068> hears<WH8085> the needy,<WH34> And does not despise<WH959> His [who are] prisoners.<WH615>
Let heaven<WH8064> and earth<WH776> praise<WH1984> Him, The seas<WH3220> and everything<WH3605> that moves<WH7430> in them.
For God<WH430> will save<WH3467> Zion<WH6726> and build<WH1129> the cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> That they may dwell<WH3427> there<WH8033> and possess<WH3423> it.
And the descendants<WH2233> of His servants<WH5650> will inherit<WH5157> it, And those who love<WH157> His name<WH8034> will dwell<WH7931> in it.
